alert.note: Alert for Northwest Pocahontas; Southeast Pocahontas (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 1:41AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern and eastern Pocahontas County through 215 AM EDT... At 140 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Beartown State Park, or 8 miles southwest of Marlinton, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Marlinton, Hillsboro, Buckeye, Dunmore, Cranberry Mountain Nature Center, Minnehaha Springs and Frost. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, seek shelter inside a building until the storms pass. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Charleston West Virginia.
